page.title: 05Bridge Eal _ Oakpool
page.content: A little over a mile further on,you will reach two old cottages at {Bridge {Eal.}Note thet the footpath crosses through fields at this stage and not along the riverbank.You should note the date{"1836"}above the top window of the rear cottage.The path passes near the front garden;go over concrete bridge.After 175 metres cross white footbridge over {Crockton Burn.} Continue on through{Chapel House} { Wood,}past{Kiddy Green}until you reach{Oakpool Farmhouse.}This building contains apigeon cote,bearing the date "1815" and a legend,barely readable {"Let me fly in time of need, { My young ones for to feed".} Go through gate turn right at the tarmac road and cross the fine stone bridge over the river.
